data.title: A letter among others
data.statement:
John added obfuscation chars to send encrypted literary quotes to his friends ...
Use indications from the first Lines to output them in human readable text !

testCases.title: CodinGame
testCases.testOut:
Program is a game ...
=> so : Codingame :-) !

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testOut:
The code does not wait,
+ Codingames are fun.

testCases.title: Unencrypted
testCases.testIn:

- J.M. Ledger

- J.M. Ledger

testCases.title: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
testCases.testOut:
"Sea and sky were a single ash-gray thing and the sands of the beach,
which on March nights glimmered like powdered light,
had become a stew of mud and rotten shellfish."
- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

testCases.title: Alice Munro
testCases.testOut:
"In your life there are a few places,
or maybe only the one place,
where something happened,
and then there are all the other places."
- Alice Munro

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read f:int c:int x:int
loop n read crytedQuote:string(360)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> count [[n]] of Lines in the quote
<<Line 2 :>> 3 space-separated numbers :
- first number : position [[f]] of the first char(s) to get,
- second number : quantity [[c]] of consecutive chars to get,
- third number : offset [[x]] of the next [[c]] char(s) to get,

<<Next [[n]] Lines :>> John's encrypted part of the quote
data.outputDescription: << [[n]] Lines :>> Decrypted parts of the literary quote

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

John added obfuscation chars to send encrypted literary quotes to his friends ...
Use indications from the first Lines to output them in human readable text !
Input
Line 1 : count n of Lines in the quote
Line 2 : 3 space-separated numbers :
- first number : position f of the first char(s) to get,
- second number : quantity c of consecutive chars to get,
- third number : offset x of the next c char(s) to get,

Next n Lines : John's encrypted part of the quote
Output
n Lines : Decrypted parts of the literary quote
Constraints
2 <= n <= 5
f is Ordinal Number
Example
Input
2
1 1 2
P.r.o.g.r.a.m. .i.s. .a. .g.a.m.e. ......
=.>. .s.o. .:. .C.o.d.i.n.g.a.m.e. .:.-.). .!
Output
Program is a game ...
=> so : Codingame :-) !
